quotes.quote: Those who don't know history are destined to repeat it.
History is the version of past events that people have decided to agree upon.
Study history, study history. In history lies all the secrets of statecraft.
History never looks like history when you are living through it.
History is not a burden on the memory but an illumination of the soul.
History is a relentless master. It has no present, only the past rushing into the future. To try to hold fast is to be swept aside.
History will be kind to me for I intend to write it.
History is a gallery of pictures in which there are few originals and many copies.
Human history becomes more and more a race between education and catastrophe.
History is the sum total of things that could have been avoided.
History is a cyclic poem written by time upon the memories of man.
History is a pack of lies about events that never happened told by people who weren't there.
You have to look at history as an evolution of society.
History is indeed little more than the register of the crimes, follies, and misfortunes of mankind.
History doesn't repeat itself, but it does rhyme.
If you want to understand today, you have to search yesterday.
History is a novel for which the people is the author.
History: gossip well told.
History is filled with the sound of silken slippers going downstairs and wooden shoes coming up.
History is man's best guess as to what the past would look like if everything had happened in chronological order.
History does not unfold: it piles up.
History, as long as it continues to happen, is always another chance.
History is a guide to navigation in perilous times. History is who we are and why we are the way we are.
History, despite its wrenching pain, cannot be unlived, but if faced with courage, need not be lived again.
Those who cannot remember the past are condemned to repeat it.
History isn't about dates and places and wars. It's about the people who fill the spaces between them.
Never doubt that you can change history. You already have.
History repeats itself, first as tragedy, second as farce.
A generation which ignores history has no past - and no future.
Sometimes history takes things into its own hands.
History repeats itself, and that's one of the things that's wrong with history.
The history of the past is but one long struggle upward to equality.
We are not makers of history. We are made by history.
A history in which every particular incident may be true may on the whole be false.
Every true history must force us to remember that the past was once as real as the present and as uncertain as the future.
History is the discipline closest to life; and life is rarely free of contradictions.
History is like a bloodstain that keeps on showing on the wall no matter how many new owners take possession, no matter how many times we paint over it.
We cannot escape history.
Our ignorance of history causes us to slander our own times.
The game of history is usually played by the best and the worst over the heads of the majority in the middle.
History books that contain no lies are extremely dull.
History is the interpretation of the significance that the past has for us.
History does not merely touch on language, but takes place in it.
If history were taught in the form of stories, it would never be forgotten.
Anybody can make history; only a great man can write it.
History is the record of an encounter between character and circumstances.
History does nothing; it does not possess immense riches, it does not fight battles. It is men, real, living, who do all this.
History is the only laboratory we have in which to test the consequences of thought.
Our history is not our destiny.
If you want the present to be different from the past, study the past.
That men do not learn very much from the lessons of history is the most important of all the lessons of history.
History will have to record that the greatest tragedy of this period of social transition was not the strident clamor of the bad people, but the appalling silence of the good people.
Who controls the past controls the future. Who controls the present controls the past.
History is a vast early warning system.
Neither a wise man nor a brave man lies down on the tracks of history to wait for the train of the future to run over him.
The disadvantage of men not knowing the past is that they do not know the present.
The only thing new in the world is the history you don't know.
You don't change the course of history by turning the faces of portraits to the wall.
A nation that forgets its past can function no better than an individual with amnesia.
Whoso neglects learning in his youth, loses the past and is dead for the future.
History is indeed the witness of the times, the light of truth.
History is merely a list of surprises. It can only prepare us to be surprised yet again.
History is the study of lies, anyway, because no witness ever recalls events with total accuracy, not even eyewitnesses.
To know the truth of history is to realize its ultimate myth and its inevitable ambiguity.

quotes.cite: History never repeats itself. Man always does.
quotes.quote: History never repeats itself. Man always does.
We learn from history that we do not learn from history.
History is the essence of innumerable biographies.
That is the supreme value of history. The study of it is the best guarantee against repeating it.
History is Philosophy teaching by example.
The past does not repeat itself, but it rhymes.
History is the action and reaction of these two, nature and thought.
We study history in order to intervene in the course of history.
For history is to the nation as memory is to the individual.
Since the dawn of history, mankind has honoured and respected brave and honest people.
It takes a great deal of history to produce a little literature.
History is a pageant and not a philosophy.
History, that excitable and unreliable old lady.
The history of every country begins in the heart of a man or a woman.
History is no more than memories refined.
In history, a great volume is unrolled for our instruction, drawing the materials of future wisdom from the past errors and infirmities of mankind.

History, like a vast river, propels logs, vegetation, rafts, and debris; it is full of live and dead things, some destined for resurrection; it mingles many waters and holds in solution invisible substances stolen from distant soils.
History has to be rewritten because history is the selection of those threads of causes or antecedents that we are interested in.
History is a symphony of echoes heard and unheard. It is a poem with events as verses.
History must not be written with bias, and both sides must be given, even if there is only one side.
History only exists, in the final analysis, for God.
History is full of the dead weight of things which have escaped the control of the mind, yet drive man on with a blind force.
